instructions: Connect your phone to your computer using a USB cable. Let it charge for 15 minutes. Disconnect the cable from your device (not the computer). Reconnect the cable within 10 seconds of disconnecting it. Charge your device for a further 30 minutes. Press and hold the Power button for five seconds. Tap Restart on your screen. If you don t see Restart , hold the power button for a further 30 seconds.

Reply Siju December 14, 2014 at 4:11 pm following experiment is not be repeated(unless... ) i had tegra note 7 (nvidia/xolo). i wasn't using the tablet for few days(probably got switched off because of the low charge ). When i put it on charging, there was no charging animation. After an hour in trying switching it on, nothing happened. Then I started searching internet and came across this site. The battery of tegra note is non removable and soldered directly on to mother board unlike nexus 7(1st gen), so removing battery was out of question. Then i tried pressing the power as recommended, nothing happened. neither did the recovery mode . So i opened the back panel and checked the battery voltage with multimeter, it showed 3.17V. Connected the usb charger and checked (with charger connected) , it showed the same voltage again. I then connected the tegra note battery with an external power supply(4.9V, 2A.. directly) and boosted the voltage till 3.3V.... connected the usb cable... charging animation is back... and device booted after 5 min .. Happy ending :-) Reply daniel December 10, 2014 at 10:02 am So first my samsung tab 3 wont open even if i press the power button for an hour then i tried to take it off but guess what.....,there is no way you cant take it out even with screws ok srsly samsung atleast put screws so we can open it to check and i put it in the chsrger for 24 hours 1 day and still doesnt open i dont want to buy an iphone you can just call text and play games you cant do anything not even custimize your own phone!
